results.description:
And the wheel goes round and round and the flame in our souls will never burn out. In the midst of winter, I found that there was within me, an invincible summer. From out of darkness and cold, the light - and hope - return. This is Winter.

Please join Jen Stratakis, E-RYT, for this blissful, sacred practice to celebrate the Winter Solstice with 108 Sun Salutations. The flow of poses will be accompanied by the traditional mantras. Participants do NOT need to complete every sun salutation; but that challenge is there, if you want it! Pausing to rest is acceptable and encouraged. Simply stay in the spirit of the practice, with the option of resting in Mountain Pose or Child's Pose. 

Please bring your mat, a bottle of water, and a hand towel. This extended class will conclude with a few closing poses and savasana. 

(No prior yoga experience required!) 

Please reserve your spot by calling (412) 904-1003.
results.name: Welcome Winter with the Sacred Practice of 108 Sun Salutations by Candlelight

results.description: Butler's Golf Course in Elizabeth is hosting the Erin Burkett Trio @ their restaurant Rock Run Inn. Enjoy a night of holiday cocktails and appetizer specials while listening to lovely vocals of Erin Burkett. Join us and relax from the holiday bustle for a fun night out.

results.description:
Remember the good old days...when game boxes were rectangular and thin or were shaped like an encyclopedia volume to look fetching on your bookshelf alongside Brittanica? When games like Masterpiece, Password, Acquire or Facts in Five were what gaming was all about?

Join us again for this Vintage MEEPLE event! Games from all over the world please, but none published AFTER Settlers of Catan was published in 1995.

Anticipate classics like those listed above and others like Venture, Sleuth and the mystery classic Whodunit!

And remember, because this is a MEEPLE event, it's low drama and high fun - if you don't know these games, you'll have no trouble getting folks to teach 'em to you.
results.name: MEEPLE presents: Vintage Games!

results.description:
http://www.carnegiesciencecenter.org/programs/adult-programs-21-plus-night/

Join us for our annual 21+ Holiday Party! This year we're celebrating our newest model on the Model Railroad & Village® , the Crawford Grill. Opened in the Hill District in 1930, the Crawford Grill became a renowned jazz club. So deck yourself out in your 1930s Sunday best as we celebrate the holiday season with jazz, dancing, and drinks!

We're turning the Works Theater into a dance club. Pittsburgh Dance Center will provide introductory dance lessons to ’30s and ’40s-era dances. Learn basic steps to swing, foxtrot, or Charleston, then put your moves to work in the fun atmosphere of the Works Theater.

Enjoy live jazz music in the Robot Lounge from local group "Jazz Conspiracy."

Participate in hands-on holiday themed science fun!

Make fake snow.
Test pH using an indicator made from poinsettias.
Play with circuits and discover why when one bulb goes out they all go out.
See and measure the difference between incandescent and LED Christmas lights.

Envision yourself into the historic Crawford Grill using our green screen.

Admission cost is just $10 for tickets purchased by Noon the day of the event or $15 if purchased at the door.
results.name: Carnegie Science Center 21+ Night Holiday Party!

Join us next week for an exclusive interview with a Holocaust survivor who says he's alive because of Oskar Schindler. Don't miss “Schindler's Youngest Survivor Speaks” at Lifetree Café next week.

He survived one of the most horrific tragedies in human history and says it's because of one man. See the incredible story during “Schindler's Youngest Survivor Speaks” at Lifetree Café this week. Who has truly changed your life? If you could say anything to that person right now, what would you say?
results.name: “Schindler's Youngest Survivor Speaks”

group.name: Lifetree Café Carnegie - Coffee, Snacks, Conversation

results.description:
If you're into music, and even if you're not, here's a great opportunity to share any music you're interested in, have a cup of coffee or tea, and engage in conversation. We'll meet at Coffee Tree Roasters in Shadyside to chat, drink coffee, and listen to music. Bring your favorite music on your phone or thumb drive to share -- you can even bring an instrument to play if you'd like. And you can just come for the coffee and company – you absolutely aren't required to bring music (I will bring my laptop to look things up on YouTube as well).

Bring any music -- if you have music of your own creation, if you're passionate about a particular musician or band, or if you just like something and feel like sharing. It could be a recent find or something that influenced your childhood and got you though your teenage years. It could be something you love or it could even be something you hate -- just tell us why. Music is as much a story as anything -- it could be a story of you, or the story of the artist who created the music, or the story could be embedded in the song itself waiting for us to listen. Feel free to bring a story to share along with the music -- or not, if you prefer.

We're totally open to any kind of music so, please, bring anything you'd like to share be it classical, ethnic, heavy metal, or whatever -- even classical ethnic heavy metal (I bet it exists). We'll be meeting at Coffee Tree Roasters from 7pm (to probably 9pm though the room's booked until 10pm).

This event is also posted on meetin.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside Coffee Tree at 7pm, head to the glass-walled meeting room in the back.
results.name: Coffee Loves Music: Holiday Edition

results.description:
In addition to limiting government's power, the framers of the U.S. Constitution implemented the Checks and Balance system to ensure that no one branch of the federal government could get out of control. As long as at least one branch of government kept it's primary goal as liberty, it could stop encroachments on the freedom of the people by the other two branches.

But what would happen if all three branches of the federal government changed their agendas from freedom to power and coercion? The vast majority of American citizens are unaware that the framers, who understood that a law is only as good as it's enforced, implemented a check and balance for such a situation as well. Fortunately, our system of government gives the power to the County Sheriff to either ignore or enforce Federal law. Neither the President of the United States, the U.S. Congress nor the U.S. Supreme Court can tell the County Sheriff what to do in his or her own county.

The County Sheriff is elected by the people, not employed by any branch of the government. Because he/she takes an oath to uphold the Constitution for the United States, his/her loyalty is towards protecting freedom. He/she decides which laws are Constitutional and will be enforced and which laws violate his/her constituents' rights and will be ignored. For the choices he/she makes, he/she will answer directly to the residents of his county, not the federal government. Ultimately, the County Sheriff is the check to balance any overreaching authority of the federal government, and is thus the last line of protection against any and all intrusive actions and legislation.

The Sheriff Project is designed to educate resident volunteers as to what they may rightly expect from their County Sheriff and how to determine if their Sheriff is fulfilling his/her oath to the U.S. Constitution. If the Sheriff is not, the residents, as the Sheriff Project, develop an action plan to either cultivate a relationship with their Sheriff or remove him/her from office. They stand with their Sheriff and do everything possible to aid him/her in defending their freedoms and promoting peace, security and constitutional law within the boundaries of their county.

For more information, see:

The Sheriff - More Power than the President

http://alleghenysheriffproject.weebly.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We are usually in the back room where the back door is.
results.name: Allegheny County Sheriff Project Study Lesson (1st & 3rd Fridays)

results.description:
http://www.carnegiesciencecenter.org/programs/adult-programs-21-plus-night/

Join us for our annual 21+ Holiday Party! This year we're celebrating our newest model on the Model Railroad & Village® , the Crawford Grill. Opened in the Hill District in 1930, the Crawford Grill became a renowned jazz club. So deck yourself out in your 1930s Sunday best as we celebrate the holiday season with jazz, dancing, and drinks!

We're turning the Works Theater into a dance club. Pittsburgh Dance Center will provide introductory dance lessons to ’30s and ’40s-era dances. Learn basic steps to swing, foxtrot, or Charleston, then put your moves to work in the fun atmosphere of the Works Theater.

Enjoy live jazz music in the Robot Lounge from local group "Jazz Conspiracy."

Participate in hands-on holiday themed science fun!

Make fake snow.
Test pH using an indicator made from poinsettias.
Play with circuits and discover why when one bulb goes out they all go out.
See and measure the difference between incandescent and LED Christmas lights.

Envision yourself into the historic Crawford Grill using our green screen.

Admission cost is just $10 for tickets purchased by Noon the day of the event or $15 if purchased at the door. We will meet inside at the front entrance.
results.name: Carnegie Science Center 21+ Holiday Party

results.description: Join us for our next Single Out meet-up for gay singles in the greater Pittsburgh area. Getting together on friday Dec 18th at 7pm at Baja Bar & Grill, not to far from the Waterworks Plaza in Fox Chapel (inside the yacht club, but very relaxed & casual too). This is a nice opportunity to socialize & get acquainted with other like-minded singles and make new friends, dates, or relationships. We generally have 35-55 in attendance (many sign up thru Facebook & other sites too) so it's the perfect sized group for meeting lots of new people. Total cost is $30 cash and includes salad, 2 entrees (breaded chicken with cranberries & tilapia), vegetable, potato, dessert, private party room, non-alcoholic beverages, and tax & tip. Can also stay for free and enjoy the popular local pop band "No Bad Juju" who will be performing sometime after 9:30pm. It's a good deal & nice way to enjoy the holidays. You never know who you might meet. Hope you can join the party!
results.name: Single Out for LGBTQ singles Dec. 2015 Christmas Party

results.description:
Read all 3, just 2, or only 1, or just come for the conversation- you are welcome! :) We are more an idea club than a book club, so instead of discussing specific questions about each book, we read the books, and then let the discussion of ideas from the readings happen as we chat.

The Deeper Genome: Why There Is More to the Human Genome than Meets the Eye
John Parrington

Life at the Speed of Light: From the Double Helix to the Dawn of Digital Life
J. Craig Venter

The Language of Life: DNA and the Revolution in Personalized Medicine
Francis S. Collins

Bonjour!


This is the plan for this Sat the 19th - new members are always welcome if you want to check it out. French in Action is a lively video method for learning French - based on native French expressions and invention.  

IMP - if you want to attend please read up on the system by watching the introductory videos online at:

</a> <a href="http://www.learner.org/resources/series83.html">http://www.learner.org/resources/series83.html


If you think this is for you - I will add you to the list who has access to the online Text and Audio Files (there is a very LARGE number of audio files and lab work.  You don’t need to do all of it, but can if you want to.  I will provide a condensed study guide to those who don’t have the time to do everything.  Also - I’m thinking of providing a video overview (of yours truly) for those who miss lessons (pour un petit prix, bien sûr). 


This week (Sat 5 - 19) we be covering:


BEGINNING

- chapters 7 (finishing maybe get to 8) (Portraits 1-2) in beg. and continuing with 


INTERMEDIATE

- chapters 20 (maybe get to 21) (Ecole 1-2) in French in action. 

I will provide vocabulary and lesson handouts in class as well as supplement the audio exercises with specific homework.

Materials will be distributed online for participating members.

Fee is $10 for the 1 or 2 hours.

The session will be divided into 2 parts:

• Beginning (10-11) Textbook we are using now is FRENCH IN ACTION (any edition). I have pdf copies of other materials.Intermediate (11-12) 

You are welcome to stay for both sections.

Just a reminder: if you cannot come for whatever reason please be so kind as to cancel your RSVP online. That helps let me not print so many docs. And gives your spot them someone else. Merci!


This will be supplemented with other grammar / vocabulary.

results.description:
And what can Santa bring you this year? Hmmm.... No, I think you have all been too naughty to expect any of that. But how about this for a holiday treat? We will gather around once more for the last event on Western PA Gaming's 2015 calendar. It's not as long as all 12 days of Christmas, but it is 10 hours of gaming, and what could make a happier holiday season?

We are having another Saturday gaming event at the Market District Express with the closest thing we have to St. Nick -- jolly ol' Redbeard!


Please accept our apologies for being unable to find an organizer team member to staff a Saturday meetup on December 12th, which the pattern up to now would have predicted. Busy time of year for many folks, Redbeards included.

It was a surprisingly well attended event on the Saturday of November 28th. Nine of us turkeys flew in and out of the event, scratching out what fun we could find in the time we could spare. Games played included Roll for the Galaxy with the Ambition expansion, Champions of Midgard, Codenames, Legendary: Marvel Deckbuilding, Pandemic: The Cure, Istanbul, Cloud 9, Bang! The Dice Game, and I believe some diehards stayed on to knock out one last game of Cabo. We had novices and some hard-boiled gamers, Some games being taught by the patient folks that volunteer for the duty, and lots of fun all around.

So bring a game you want to try, or come try some games that you likely won't find in the toy aisle at Wal-Mart. These games come from all over the world. We have a group of folks who are usually excited to teach someone a new game, and we have people who are very game (sorry) to give any games that you may bring a shot. Experienced? Inexperienced? In between? Need a little coaching to get through your turn? Ready to give it a shot? Come out and see us! Drop in any time after Noon. People come and go all day. Some don't even RSVP. There is no admission to attend. There is a rather good selection on food as well, and for those who would enjoy a beer, they do have it on site. We'll be playing in the dining area. The dining area and food preparation services both shut down at 10 PM, even though the convenience store area of the building remains open until 12 AM.

And thanks once again for spending your free time with us all 2015 long! We'll be back in the new year. If you have ideas for venues and towns to hold an event, please do contact me. We know there are a lot of towns that hope to game that we are missing on the map.

Text me with your questions here on meetup, or on my cell (724)[masked] . new number for me

Merry Christmas, Happy Holidays, and a safe and Happy new year to one and all. Hope to see more of you in 2016!
results.name: Saturday Gaming - Giant Eagle Market District Express (2015 Finale!)

Let us come together to build a community of meditators and spread the benefits of meditation among Pittsburghers. So come and join with us in a Joyful meditation for health and happiness and tell the whole city "I Meditate Pittsburgh." :-)

There are no prerequisites and all above 12 yrs of age are welcome to join. Consider telling your friends and bring them along.

Event will be simple. We will start with some introduction to meditation, do some gentle stretches and have a guided meditation with the group. At the end we will share our experiences and open floor for questions and discussions. You can also ask any questions you may have in the beginning or email us now.

Please RSVP for the event and we look forward to seeing you.

results.description:
We're having a Meetup Happy Hour at 5pm so decided to have a Meetup Leadership meeting at 4pm for the FIVE meetups admin'd by Frank.  We almost have 400 event organizers between the five meetups.  Plus that gives you a chance to catch a bite to eat if you were going to the Happy Hour anyhow and wanted to get your food order before we overwhelm them...  I'm expecting about 10-20 people to show up to this at max... but i might be wrong.  The happy hour I expect over 100+

0.  This is also open to people that want to become event organizers so they can get the word out for Social/fun/interesting events.  examples they have a friend in a band, movie nights, Dancing, dinners, happy hours, coffee klatches and whatever else social you want to post. (No Multi-level marketing).

1. To meet other event organizers.

2. Any questions about setting up meetup events or how to do better getting events to work.

3.  Teach people who want to setup events.

4.  Trying to setup a Meetup Dining Committee and a Meetup Movie Committee.

5.  Help get the word out to get some new meetup members.  Frank will be asking for your help on this.

Trying to get the meetups to be a little bit more Active in the Pittsburgh Region because winter is the time to do this, because we aren't competing with summer events.

Hope to see you at the Fox & Hound, afterwards is the Multi-Meetup Happy Hour.  Dress Festive if you want: Ugly Holiday Sweaters, Sexy elf or Missus Claus, or just a santa hat.  You don't have to do this.  I'll probably wear a santa hat.

Cheers

Frank ;-)

Big Kahuna of 5 Meetups:

Free & Almost Free in Pittsburgh 10,300 members

Pittsburgh Social Club 3,100 members

Amazing Pittsburgh 1,700 members

Pittsburgh Events 1,100 members

412 Social\Pittsburgh Happy Hour 1,400 members

Don't miss your opportunity to celebrate the season with an urban adventure. Join us for a tour of Pittsburgh during the holiday season, where we'll stop and visit many of the city's sights along the way to check out the festive holiday decorations and twinkling lights.

Group will meet and finish at the Allegheny Station. We'll take the T to the Gateway Station, exit T,  urban hike through the city,  and then, take the Duquesne Incline to Mt. Washington. Our adventure will continue down McArdle Road and across the Liberty Bridge ending at the First Avenue Station where we'll catch the T back to Allegheny Station.

Follow this link to view a map of a route taken previously--> Click Here

Thank you for your interest in our free "Holiday Lights Urban Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our new centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!


If we have more than 10 people paying for the Duquesne Incline, we'll pay the group rate. I'll collect the fares and rates are listed below.


***Come prepared with exact change***
Duquesne Incline Fares:
Standard one-way rates:
Adults (Ages 12-64) $2.50
Children (Ages 6-11) $1.25

If we have enough participants, a group rate will apply:
Group rates are valid for any group of ten or more people
Adults (Ages 12-64) $1.75
Children (Ages 6-11) $1.00

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be ~5 miles

What to bring:
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton)
Comfortable Outdoor Footwear
Two Light Sources: e.g. Headlamp, Flashlight, Extra Flashlight
Water to stay hydrated
Snacks
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement Click Here

Optional: Optics, Lip Balm, Camera, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors.


Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall 
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive (Map) 
Pittsburgh, PA  15237 
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools 
Website | Meetup | Twitter | Facebook

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 11:00AM at the tennis court of Schenley Park  and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Sunday morning tennis for all levels - Schenley

results.description:
Come celebrate 3 years of raising awareness through books and movies, with a potluck and film screening. Bring a vegan dish to pass! Beverages will be purchased from The Big Idea.

The Vegan Book Club is open to everyone: The intention is to provide a comfortable, welcoming, environment for people to explore issues related to Veganism.

This month's film selection is  "Unity"-- a feature-length documentary that explores humanity’s hopeful transformation from living by killing into living by loving. It is a unique film about compassion for all beings. Writer/Director Shaun Monson, collaborating with an astounding cast of 100 celebrity narrators, presents a message of love, tragedy and hope, all set against the backdrop of some of the most compelling 20th and 21st Century footage imaginable. Presented in chapters, UNITY takes an in-depth look at what it truly means to be human, to be mortal, and to be incarnate in this world. Watch the trailer at https://unitythemovement.com/
results.name: Vegan Book Club 3rd Anniversary POTLUCK and film screening

results.description:
Movie starts at 1:05.

“In the Heart of the Sea” stars Chris Hemsworth ("Marvel's The Avengers," "Rush") as the vessel's veteran first mate Owen Chase; Benjamin Walker ("Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter") as its inexperienced Captain, George Pollard; Cillian Murphy ("The Dark Knight Rises") as second mate Matthew Joy; and Ben Whishaw ("Skyfall") as novelist Herman Melville, whose inquiries into the event 30 years later helped bring the story to light. In the winter of 1820, the New England whaling ship Essex was assaulted by something no one could believe: a whale of mammoth size and will, and an almost human sense of vengeance. The real-life maritime disaster would inspire Melville's Moby-Dick. But that told only half the story. "In the Heart of the Sea" reveals the encounter's harrowing aftermath, as the ship's surviving crew is pushed to their limits and forced to do the unthinkable to stay alive. Braving storms, starvation, panic and despair, the men will call into question their deepest beliefs, from the value of their lives to the morality of their trade, as their captain searches for direction on the open sea and his first mate still seeks to bring the great whale down. The film also stars Tom Holland ("The Impossible") as young seaman Tom Nickerson, and Brendan Gleeson ("Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1") as the same man, 30 years later. Spanish actor Jordi Mollà ("Riddick") is the captain of another ship, the Archimedes, who tries to warn the Essex of what may lie ahead.

Dinner afterwards at Chili's Grill & Bar, 2020 Pittsburgh Mills Blvd, Tarentum PA 15084.  (The restaurant is just on the other side of the mall, next to the bank)

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
We will be working through lesson 8 in the book. "Japanese for Busy People" book 2 version 3.   As usual, we'll meet in Classroom C.


Let's try to figure out how we can improve upon what we are learning so that we can make it both more interactive and at the same time begin to really use our language skills.  Do we want to try having more quizzes?  Interactive dialog?  Roleplaying?

Last week we left off at the end of Lesson 7, and decided to study the Lesson 7 Kanji, as well as the first three pages of the Lesson 7 workbook exercises.  After we review those, we will pick up with Lesson 8.

If anyone has any ideas for other things they'd like to try let me know.

results.description:
In Russia New Year's Eve is considered to be an almost magical time when the most unlikely coincidences, situations and meetings are likely to happen.
Two long-time frenemies accidentally meet on a landing of a highrise in a middle of Moscow shortly before midnight on a New Year's Eve. As the evening unfolds, through conversations, fights, unexpected twists & turns, comical situations, and meeting other characters these two shift between hating each other and admiring - over and over again.
And as the New Year approaches, it brings with it the biggest surprise of them all.

In Russian with English subtitles.

Sun, Dec 20, 4pm, JCC Katz Hall, 5738 Darlington Rd, Squirrel Hill.
Tickets $12 for students, $20 for adults.
Light refreshments provided during the intermission.
results.name: Happy New Year! - Contemporary Russian Comedy by Pittsburgh Russian Theater

results.description: The First Lutheran Church will again be holding its annual German-language Christmas service on Sunday, December 20th at 4pm. The church is located downtown, 615 Grant Street, across the street from the US Steel Tower. A reception will follow. Reduced parking for $1.00 is available in the Mellon Square and Smithfield/Liberty garages. Tickets must be validated at the church to receive this rate. The service will be conducted by The Rev. Horst H. Bandle a native of Germany and pastor- in- residence at First Lutheran Church. The guest lector will be Paul Overby, Honorary Consul of the Federal Republic of Germany and President of the German American Chamber of Commercy. Special music by the Teutonia Mannerchor, Damenchor, Pittsburgh Posaunenchor, André Bierman, (Tenor Soloist) and the Gloria Dei Ringers will highlight the service, with the traditional Christmas Carols. First Lutheran Church is pleased to provide this Christmas ministry to the German community.
results.name: German Christmas Service

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

venue.name: Meet outside Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill / Repair the World

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.
results.name: Entrepreneur Monday Morning Roundtable - Entrepreneurs Helping Each Other

results.description: If you only read one section of the Bible, we suggest Matthew Chapters 5-7. That is the collection of Jesus's wisdom known as the "Sermon on the Mount," containing the Beatitudes. These sayings are basically all you need to know about Christianity. In the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus makes it quite clear how to reach the kingdom of heaven (a.k.a. Christ Consciousness), but it helps if you read it in his native language - spirit. We will do precisely that in this group. (Hint: No "costumes" allowed as egos are incapable of interpreting this sermon correctly!)

results.description:
ONLY THE PEOPLE CAN SAVE AMERICA - WILL YOU?

We are establishing administrations for common law grand juries in all 3144 counties in the United States of America. By doing this, the people will move our courts back to “Courts of Justice” and take back 100% control of their government.

THE DUTY OF THE COMMON LAW GRAND JURY is to right any wrong. If anyone’s unalienable rights have been violated, or removed, without a legal sentence of their peers the grand jury can restore them. And if a dispute shall arise concerning this matter it shall be settled according to the judgment of the grand jurors, the sureties of the peace.

IN A US SUPREME COURT STUNNING 6 TO 3 DECISION JUSTICE ANTONIN SCALIA, writing for the majority, confirmed that the American grand jury is neither part of the judicial, executive nor legislative branches of government, but instead belongs to the people. It is in effect a fourth branch of government "governed" and administered to directly by and on behalf of the American people, and its authority emanates from the Bill of Rights and has the power to enforce law and remove people from office.

GRAND JURY BACKGROUND

When the American colonies separated from England, King George retaliated by revoking the charters. Technically, the colonies were without any legal authority to operate. However, civics (the branch of political philosophy concerned with individual rights) was generally taught and known by the people who asserted their rights and maintained order by applying the common law. The people united in the form of common law grand juries and continued the functioning of government.

As the legislatures matured they slowly increased governmental power while simultaneously reducing personal sovereign power. This was done through a combination of passing pro-government legislation and reducing or eliminating education about civics. Today, two and a quarter centuries later, hardly anyone even knows the meaning of the word, "civics."

Despite the fact that the state and federal constitutions still acknowledge the common law as the ultimate law system, people everywhere are conditioned to believe that the statutory law and codes are the only source of law. The only remaining common law term generally known among the public is "common law marriage."

The common law grand jury is now dormant only because of the public ignorance of its powers that supersede all other government entities, including the modern statutorily defined grand jury.

WHAT TO DO NEXT:

Click www.NationalLibertyAlliance.org, read the home page and view the video "The Power of the Grand Jury" on that page. Read the Preface and the Mission Statement under the "Welcome" tab in the navigation bar above. Then, to join our endeavor, click "Register" at the top right side of the page. After you log in, click on the "Jurist" tab that will appear on the navigation bar, and you will see step by step instructions on what to do next. You can find names and phone numbers of County Organizers and State Coordinators under "Directory" in the navigation bar.

National Liberty Alliance (Hyde Park, NY) - Meetup Group

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!

results.description:
Beginner ukulele players in the South Hills of Pittsburgh. Now  you can jam with other newer players at Mt. Lebanon Library the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of each month.

These sessions are for players who have had a few lessons or know some basic chords and want to learn more while playing with others. We will experiment with basic strums, alternate chords and how to move from one chord to the next. We will play songs slowly at first and then again, only faster.

The group will choose the songs they want to play using "The Daily Ukulele 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is available from local music stores and online.

Bring your ukulele and a floor music stand along with the music book. If you want to play songs other than what is in this book, please notify the group the week prior so copies can be made.

As we are progressing, we are now opening the group to more advanced players and more challenging music selections.

If you have any questions, please contact Patty Williams at [masked].
results.name: Beginner Ukulele Jam - 4th Tuesday

See this event information at: http://www.gamemasterspgh.com/?tribe_events=deadlands-the-weird-west&eventDate=2015-03-11

This game is looking for players. "Deadlands: The Weird West" is a setting
where steam-powered jetpacks and zeppelins share space with cowboys,
sharp-eyed prospectors, and smoky desert saloons while inhuman
abominations and unsettling mysteries hide in every shadow.
 1876. The American Civil War has been going for 17 years with
no end in sight, and now being fought with steam-powered
tanks, flying machines, and man-portable Gatling rifles. The Quake of
 smashed California into a labyrinth of shattered plateaus and
treacherous rapids known as the "Great Maze", and the Sioux Nations
have reclaimed the Dakotas.
 Rumors have spread across the nation that the West is beset by
everything from giant, man-eating bats to the walking dead, and while
people in more civilized parts of the continent think  all
bunk,  mostly because the Union and Confederate governments
have done their best to hide the facts from them: truth is, magic and
monsters are very, very real, and there are larger forces behind their
sudden return.
 Anyone is free to join, regardless of prior experience: just walk in
and ask. I can be contacted through my e-mail or at[masked] (aim
for 11:30 AM to 5:30 PM) and am happy to help with character creation,
take suggestions on what mood or tone you would like to see in the
game, and answer questions.
results.name: Deadlands - The Weird West

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 7:30PM at the tennis court of Cranberry Community park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Wednesday night tennis for all levels - Cranberry

results.description:
​​SAVE THE DATE!
KWANZAA SCREENING ON DECEMBER 26TH

Celebrate Kwanzaa with the Film Festival!

TALES OF ​ THE NIGHT
​Saturday, December 26th​

REGISTRATION ON EVENTBRITE A MUST!  Here's the link:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tales-of-the-night-tickets-19931460535

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uEe50hBveO0

​​(Courtesy of GKids.com)


Tales of the Night is renowned animation auteur Michel Ocelot (Kirikou and the Sorceress, Azur & Asmar)’s first foray into 3D animation. A hit at the Berlin Film Festival, the film extends the earlier shadow puppet style of Ocelot’s Princes and Princesses, with black silhouetted characters set off against exquisitely detailed Day-Glo backgrounds bursting with color and kaleidoscopic patterns – the subtle use of 3D creating a diorama-like effect. The film weaves together six exotic fables each unfolding in a unique locale, from Tibet, to medieval Europe, an Aztec kingdom, the African plains, and even the Land of the Dead. In Ocelot’s storytelling, history blends with fairytale as viewers are whisked off to enchanted lands full of dragons, werewolves, captive princesses, sorcerers, and enormous talking bees – and each fable ends with its own ironic twist.
results.name: Sembene Film Festival Screens Tales of the Night

results.description:
A poignant tale, starring Michael Caine and Harvey Keitel, of how we each find passion in life. Caine and Keitel play a composer and a film director, long-time friends, vacationing at a Swiss spa as they ponder their next moves.

Jane Fonda gives a Golden Globe nominated performance as Keitel's muse.

The film received European Film Awards for Best Film, Director and Actor (Caine).

Film screens at 4:15. Meet inside theater where film is playing.

Thank you for your interest in our free "Snowshoe or Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our new centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be about 4 miles

What to bring:
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton)
Sturdy Hiking Boots
Two Light Sources: Headlamp, Flashlight, Extra Flashlight, etc.
Water to stay hydrated
Snacks
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement  Click Here

Additional: Lip Balm, Camera, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines, Eye Protection

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors. 

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall 
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive (Map) 
Pittsburgh, PA  15237 
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools 
Website | Meetup | Twitter | Facebook
results.how_to_find_us: In the parking lot
results.name: Full Moon Hike Outing

Dec 26th - (NEW ROOM ) The Crafty Jacklope -8PM , Bridgeville, PA. <a>https://www.facebook.com/The-Crafty-Jackalope-38373200515…/ plus</a> .. we have an encore performance scheduled by a very special guest performer .. the one and only Katie Simone https://www.facebook.com/TheKatieSimone/?fref=ts

plus even more .. special guest guitarist and vocalist .. Dennis Malley https://www.facebook.com/denmalley?fref=ts   man can this guy kick it !

Featuring the dancers:

*Macabre Noir - director of Steel City Burlesque Academy and Best Variety Entertainer of Great Southern Exposure Burlesque Pageant!!

*Lita D'Vargas - assistant director of the Steel City Burlesque Academy

*Lilith Deville - founding member of Kabarett Vulgare!

*Kat de Lac - founder of Steel City Kitty Variety show and international traveller

Live music by:

Phat Man Dee and The Cultural District featuring musical director and bassist Tony DePaolis, guitarist Ronald Wingfield, drummer JT Smitty Smith, and trombonist Reggie Watkins.

Let us create a new holiday tradition that includes Candy Cane Strip Teases, dancing dreidles and Elf-lesque while Phat Man Dee and her band play salacious holiday classics like "Let it Snow" and Ellington's "Sugar Rum Cherry"

While Pittsburgh's top burlesque superstars shimmy it up one side and shake it down the other! Ho ho ho and a Merry ChristmaChannaKwanzaa to you and you and you! We don't care if you've been naughty or if you've been nice! We're gonna show you what Eve showed Adam and we're not talking about the apples! We're calling on and co-mingling the spirits of the Moulin Rouge and old Saint Nick so you can join us and celebrate the holidays with the classiest show in town!

Do join us, it will be a delightful evening of debaucherous holiday celebrations! Use the code "PHATHOLIDAY" at check out online to get the tickets for $15 instead of $20! VIP Tables avail for $75 for seating 4 by the stage!

results.description:
The Church of the Resurrection in Brookline has invited us to Pittsburgh Mass Mob their church! Church of the Resurrection has a very interesting history. According to the diocesan web site, it is as follows:


Parish History

"Resurrection parish was established in 1909. The origin of the parish can be traced to the opening of the Mt. Washington Streetcar Tunnel in 1904. Before the tunnel opened, travel to Pittsburgh from the South Hills was time consuming and difficult. This kept the population in the area down. Once travel to and from Pittsburgh became easier, Brookline experienced a rapid growth. By 1909, Brookline had grown to the point that a parish could be supported. On May 3, 1909, land for a church was purchased and on May 25, the parish was officially established. The first Mass of the parish was celebrated on May 30 in a rented storeroom. This storeroom served as a church for a year. Beginning in June of 1909, work began on a combined church and school building. The cornerstone was laid on September 19, 1909, and the first Mass was celebrated in the new church on March 27, 1910. The basement of the building was devoted to the church and the upper floor constituted the school. To meet the growing needs of the school, a second floor and a wing was added to the original building in 1912. A second wing was added in 1923 to 1924. A final addition, connecting the two wings, was constructed in 1928.

The continuing growth of the parish led to the building of a new church. Ground for the church was broken on April 25, 1938, and the completed church was dedicated on February 13, 1939. The original church was converted into a gym and, in 1953, into four classrooms. The church was renovated in 1955 and 1984."

Known for it's breathtaking picture behind the altar,, it is another one of Pittsburgh's jewels!

There will be a tour after Mass as well as a light reception.

Please be sure to bring your family and friends for this exciting opportunity to enjoy a "view from another pew" again!

ps,, here is a preview video of this beautiful church!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e7vO6GoS44c
results.name: Pittsburgh Mass Mob XVII

Steeler's Party at Coach's Bottleshop in Banksville

Sun. Dec. 27th!

We've been invited back at Coach's on banksville rd very conveniently located just a couple minutes from town and it's an away game so the traffic should be calm.

In addition to the drink specials, Dave the manager is giving us a special half off appetizers!  Can't beat that deal!

This will once again cross posted in different meetup/facebook and feel free to invite folks. All are welcome! We've been averaging 25+ people. Let's fill the place!  And it doesn't matter if you're into the game or not, come out for the fun!  Cya there!

Don

Got about 20 people going so far, still room for a few more!  Come on out!

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones playing games.
results.name: Play Eurogames!

group.name: Free and Almost Free in Pittsburgh

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee 

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

venue.name: Meet outside Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill / Repair the World

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Note:  No beginner class tonight!)

results.description:
If you're into music, and even if you're not, here's a great opportunity to share any music you're interested in, have a cup of coffee or tea, and engage in conversation. We'll meet at Coffee Tree Roasters in Shadyside to chat, drink coffee, and listen to music. Bring your favorite music on your phone or thumb drive to share -- you can even bring an instrument to play if you'd like. And you can just come for the coffee and company – you absolutely aren't required to bring music (I will bring my laptop to look things up on YouTube as well).

Bring any music -- if you have music of your own creation, if you're passionate about a particular musician or band, or if you just like something and feel like sharing. It could be a recent find or something that influenced your childhood and got you though your teenage years. It could be something you love or it could even be something you hate -- just tell us why. Music is as much a story as anything -- it could be a story of you, or the story of the artist who created the music, or the story could be embedded in the song itself waiting for us to listen. Feel free to bring a story to share along with the music -- or not, if you prefer.

We're totally open to any kind of music so, please, bring anything you'd like to share be it classical, ethnic, heavy metal, or whatever -- even classical ethnic heavy metal (I bet it exists). We'll be meeting at Coffee Tree Roasters from 7pm (to probably 9pm though the room's booked until 10pm).

This event is also posted on meetin.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside Coffee Tree at 7pm, head to the glass-walled meeting room in the back.
results.name: Coffee Loves Music: End of the Year Edition

results.description:
ONLY THE PEOPLE CAN SAVE AMERICA - WILL YOU?

We are establishing administrations for common law grand juries in all 3144 counties in the United States of America. By doing this, the people will move our courts back to “Courts of Justice” and take back 100% control of their government.

THE DUTY OF THE COMMON LAW GRAND JURY is to right any wrong. If anyone’s unalienable rights have been violated, or removed, without a legal sentence of their peers the grand jury can restore them. And if a dispute shall arise concerning this matter it shall be settled according to the judgment of the grand jurors, the sureties of the peace.

IN A US SUPREME COURT STUNNING 6 TO 3 DECISION JUSTICE ANTONIN SCALIA, writing for the majority, confirmed that the American grand jury is neither part of the judicial, executive nor legislative branches of government, but instead belongs to the people. It is in effect a fourth branch of government "governed" and administered to directly by and on behalf of the American people, and its authority emanates from the Bill of Rights and has the power to enforce law and remove people from office.

GRAND JURY BACKGROUND

When the American colonies separated from England, King George retaliated by revoking the charters. Technically, the colonies were without any legal authority to operate. However, civics (the branch of political philosophy concerned with individual rights) was generally taught and known by the people who asserted their rights and maintained order by applying the common law. The people united in the form of common law grand juries and continued the functioning of government.

As the legislatures matured they slowly increased governmental power while simultaneously reducing personal sovereign power. This was done through a combination of passing pro-government legislation and reducing or eliminating education about civics. Today, two and a quarter centuries later, hardly anyone even knows the meaning of the word, "civics."

Despite the fact that the state and federal constitutions still acknowledge the common law as the ultimate law system, people everywhere are conditioned to believe that the statutory law and codes are the only source of law. The only remaining common law term generally known among the public is "common law marriage."

The common law grand jury is now dormant only because of the public ignorance of its powers that supersede all other government entities, including the modern statutorily defined grand jury.

WHAT TO DO NEXT:

Click www.NationalLibertyAlliance.org, read the home page and view the video "The Power of the Grand Jury" on that page. Read the Preface and the Mission Statement under the "Welcome" tab in the navigation bar above. Then, to join our endeavor, click "Register" at the top right side of the page. After you log in, click on the "Jurist" tab that will appear on the navigation bar, and you will see step by step instructions on what to do next. You can find names and phone numbers of County Organizers and State Coordinators under "Directory" in the navigation bar.

National Liberty Alliance (Hyde Park, NY) - Meetup Group

results.name: Allegheny County Common Law Grand Jury Reinstatement Committee Meeting‏

***

Highmark First Night 2016

Thursday, December 31, 2015 - 6:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.
  Admission Info: $8 in advance, $10 at the door, kids 5 and under FREE.

Event Category: Holidays

External Link: Event Website

EVENT SCHEDULE LINK: http://firstnightpgh.trustarts.org/events

Highmark First Night Pittsburgh, a production of the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust, is an arts-focused, alcohol-free, and family-friendly New Year’s Eve celebration in downtown Pittsburgh’s Cultural District.  It’s the largest single-day celebration in the region offering 150 events at nearly 50 indoor and outdoor locations within the 14-block Cultural District, attracting nearly 50,000 visitors each year.

The celebration offers something for everyone, showcasing hundreds of local, regional, and national artists, with live music, dance, comedy, magic, theater, hands-on activities, visual arts, a parade with its signature giant puppets, fire & ice plaza, and fireworks (twice!). The evening culminates on the Highmark Stage with a national headlining act, the Countdown to Midnight, and the raising of the Future of Pittsburgh Ball set against the backdrop of a beautiful Zambelli fireworks display. Admission button prices remain among the lowest in the country: advanced buttons are $8, $10 at the door, and children under 5 are admitted free.

Brought to you by:
The Pittsburgh Cultural Trust

results.description:
MEET me... Frank (Big Kahuna) here at these times & places, he will have a florescent orange Bike Flag with him to coordinate.  My number for texting (not always guaranteed to respond back cause this is a HUGE Night) is[masked]

Always meet at these places about 5 mins before it starts!  Look for the Flag.

THERE WILL BE A MAP once you get your FIRST NIGHT BUTTON LOOK FOR THESE LOCATIONS.  Remember I'will be meeting a BUNCH of YOU here, so I cannot be finding you, you need to find ME.  (look for BIKE FLAG, i will be there 5 mins beforehand, looking foolish for having a bike flag).


6:30pm - 7pm Steel Town Fire Artists and Ice Sculpture Outdoors at FIRE & ICE PLAZA  Some of my friends are in Steel Town Fire watch them spin and play with fire, don't try this at home!

7:30pm - 8:15pm Brooke Annibale WYEP Artist of the Year - 2016 at Trust Arts Education Center.   She's an amazing singer and the reason why I'm going to First Night!


9pm -9:30 Drew the Dramatic Fool (COMEDY) Pittsburgh CAPA SCHOOL MUST GET VOUCHERS FOR THIS (vouchers are free but seats are limited, 50,000 people go to First Night)!

LOTS MORE THAN THIS GOING ON!  I have a new years eve party to go to after 9:30pm


Other things I recommend going to see is Billy Price, the Balmoral Highlanders Bagpipers, The Raggae Band "The Wailers," Dwane Dolphin Jazz (he's good), "Early Mays"Appalachian Harmony.   There's more than this... the events link is below...


***

Highmark First Night 2016

Thursday, December 31, 2015 - 6:00 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.
  Admission Info: $8 in advance, $10 at the door, kids 5 and under FREE.

Event Category: Holidays

dinner at 7 PM, or just for the party at 9 PM. Gracias! :-)
-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- --  
STEEL CACTUS SHADYSIDE–OPEN BAR NYE DRINK TICKETS AVAILABLE ONLINE ONLY! Good from 8 PM–Midnight for $75! Purchase your NYE Open Bar drink tickets here:
https://www.showclix.com/event/steel-cactus-shadyside-nye.
-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- ---- -- -- -- -- --  
NEW YEAR'S EVE MEXICAN DINNER, DANCING & PARTY! 
Steel Cactus in Shadyside, 5505 Walnut St., Pgh., PA 15232 
Web Site:  http://www.steelcactuspgh.com/shadyside/ 
Menu:  http://www.steelcactuspgh.com/shadyside/menu 
Map:  https://goo.gl/maps/3hbdFzzkMiR2


DELICIOUS MEXICAN DINNER:  7 PM
(Separate checks. 20% Gratuity added.)
DJ, DANCING & NYE PARTY:  9 PM
(No cover for party if you're there for dinner.
$10 cover charge after 9 PM at the door.)
*PLEASE NOTE:  YOU MUST TELL THEM YOU'RE WITH MEETUP FOR DISCOUNT! OTHERWISE, COVER IS $15.


Please answer the RSVP questions about whether you're coming for dinner at 7 PM, or just coming later for the  party! I need to get an accurate head count for the restaurant for the sit-down dinner portion of the evening. GRACIAS, AMIGOS! 

If you can't join us for dinner, you can still come for the party and dancing after 9 PM. (Those of us having dinner won't have to pay the cover.) For those skipping dinner, the cover at the door is a very reasonable $10. You can also purchase your ticket in advance online if desired at:  https://www.showclix.com/event/steel-cactus-shadyside-nye. 

This is the best NYE deal in Pittsburgh! They will have party favors and a champagne toast at midnight. Happy New Year! Nos vemos! :-)


*This event is cross-posted to Pittsburgh Dining N' At & Burgh Adults Meetup groups. I will have a sign on the table for the Spanish Meetup, so our members can find each other.

results.description:
DID YOU EVER WANT TO DO COMEDY?

Open MIC NIGHT AT HAMBONES in Lawrenceville!   You get 5-10 mins of time and do your stuff!   Show up at 9pm to 9:30 if you want to sign up for comedy!

OR

You can just watch a good comedy night with a diverse amount of Comedians.

You'll see a good amount of diverse Pittsburgh Comedy Talent.  Some awesome and some not so much but improving their craft or their drinking skills...

FREE NO COVER!  You gotta pay for food or drinks if you want them!

***

FYI if this event happens to be ON A HOLIDAY IT IS NOT GOING ON!!!

Repeating event on Meetup!

***

From Hambones Facebook event:

Join Us This and Every Thursday Night 10 PM for Our Comedy Open Stage Hosted by Derek Minto! First Come First Choice of When You Go On.

$5 Personal Nacho Bowls, Choose From Black Bean, Chili, House Apple Wood Smoked Barbecued Pulled Pork and The Adventure Nachos($6) $2.50 Yuengling Drafts 10 PM till Midnight. There is Plenty of Street and or Bank Parking and a Lighted City Lot Across the Street.

***

THIS IS A NON-HOSTED REPEATING EVENT, Frank the Admin (aka BIG KAHUNA) knows Derek Minto (the fat bum who runs the comedy night which he does a good job ;-) ). And wants to surprise him and get people to go to his comedy night!   Plus Jeff the owner of Hambones is a great guy and well worth supporting.  FYI if this event happens to be ON A HOLIDAY IT IS NOT GOING ON!!!

results.description:
January 2016: Your 4 Best Shots of 2015  - INCLUDES PRIZES

Special Instructions: Post 4 images that you consider your best images of 2015. All of your images should be of different subjects. All 4 will be judged together as a group, plus one individual image will be chosen from all posted images. You must post 4. If your images do not post together, I will arrange them together in the pool sometime during the month or after the contest closes.

You must either add a title or numbers 1-4 in the caption of each of your images. For this contest, the winners will be chosen by our members, not by the judge of the previous contest. (The Dec winner will judge the Feb contest.) 

Voting instructions will be announced on 2/1/16 after the contest ends. For this contest, you must vote to win (but not for your own images.) Every member (whether participating in the contest or not) will be permitted to submit one ballot. 

Winners must be members at of the contest on 1/31/16 and until voting ends. Otherwise your name will disappear from under the photo (if for example, your trial membership ends) and we won't know who to vote for.

BONUS:  At least two Prizes of one-year free membership.  Winners will not have to pay dues the next time they come due! 

If this contest is successful, with lots of participation by members (both entries and voting) it may become an annual event.

(see upcoming themes below)

Please check contest rules if you have not already done so: http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-photo-safari/messages/boards/thread/32726552 

A reminder that special instructions will appear on the contest album's cover image or its comments when the contest opens.

The photo album will open at 3:15 a.m. on the 1st of the month. Photos submitted after midnight on the last day of the month will not be eligible. If you post a photo and change your mind, you may delete it and replace it with a different photo before the deadline. If more than 2 photos are submitted, the first 2 will be judged; the 3rd will not.

________


FUTURE THEMES through June 2016:

I may add suggestions for some topics. You are free to use them or not. However, if something is marked with SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS, those must be followed.

February 2016: In the Pink   Suggestions: The phrase "in the pink" usually means in good health or spirits. You can interpret the theme that way or have the main subject or most of your image be a shade of pink.

March 2016: Money

April 2016: Storm


May 2016: Junk  A mid-May meetup will give you the opportunity to take photos of lots of junk.  Details to be announced in April.


June 2016: Fabric or Textile Although not required, macro might work well on images of textiles.
results.how_to_find_us: Online event, no actual meeting.
results.name: JANUARY 2016: YOUR 4 BEST SHOTS OF 2015

group.name: The Pittsburgh Photo Safari Meetup Group

results.description:
The Monthly Theme album is an online submission album.  Read the monthly theme and then submit photos that fit the theme ALL MONTH LONG online.  There is no formal meetup for this album.

Interpret the theme as you wish. Post up literal or figurative photos. It's all about being challenged by a specified theme!

This album is not open for critiques.  If you want your photo critiqued, you may post it here if it fits the monthly theme, and then post in in the Monthly Critique Album where it will be open for constructive criticism.

For more info:

http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-photo-safari/boards/thread/28924022

results.description:
Polar Bear Plunge at Mon Wharf on New Years (a long hike off of a short pier)

My 10th YEAR!!!

When: Friday, January 1st NEW YEARS DAY!

Time: 9am  9:25am get ready! 9:30am Jump IN! 9:31 crawl out of the MON RIVER! Brrr!!!

Where: Mon Wharf Parking Lot

Meet: On the right hand side where they are Jumping in. LOOK FOR THE FLORESCENT ORANGE BIKE FLAG!!! at 9AM!

How will you find US: Look for Guy in Santa Hat with Red and Black Striped Robe (Santa Frank aka BIG KAHUNA) or LOOK FOR THE FLORESCENT ORANGE BIKE FLAG!!! at 9AM!

Cost: FREE or $20 getting a Polar Bear Club T-shirt (absolutely worth it, Buying the T Shirt benefits project bundle up! and gives you BRAGGING RIGHTS! T-shirt info at the bottom!

For more info: Pittsburgh Polar Bear Clubhttp://www.projectbundleup.com/PolarBearJump/index.html

River plunge takes place at 9:30 AM onNew Year's Day - January 1stDirections to Mon Wharf: Go to Wood street and turn towards River at Entrance of Fort Pitt Blvd and Wood Street you will see Entrance to MON Wharf

Looking for a few crazy Men/Women to make sure the New Year Starts off right! I've done this 9 of the last 10 years and look how I turned out! ;-)

Heads ups, you don't have to jump in yourself we need people to hold towels and laugh at us and TAKE PICS! (although the craziness is infective, if you are a towel holder about 80% jump in the next year!)

I'm doing the New Year's Polar Bear Plunge and might as well see who else is crazy enough to jump in the Monongahela on New Years Day with me.

Reminder Polar Bear Plunge is Sunday, New Years Day Jan 1st at Mon Warf at 9am official jump in is at 9:30. Buy a project bundle up T-shirt for $10. Usually about[masked] people this year might be more cause of the warm temps.

I'll be there in my Santa Hat and Red n Black Striped Robe. Afterwards a bunch of us are going to Penny's Diner in Southside afterward. If you find me good, if not find me at Penny's Diner in Southside for Breakfast. The Polar Bear Plunge is well worth doing, and this way your year starts off where you've done something completely weird and different.


ADVICE:1. GET THERE BEFORE 9AM it gets crowded fast!!!2. Have Blankets and a change of shorts, t shirts and socks3. There are safety personnel there.4. You'll have to set your stuff down leave valuables in your car.5. Drag someone else down there even if they aren't jumping then they can be towel/blanket holders and someone needs to laugh at us.6. Channel 4 news is a sponsor of this so you have a chance of being on the news.

*****************************Additional Advice from previous years...We jump from the Mon Wharf Parking directly across from Station Square.....and they leave the wharf parking entrance open...it'll look closed and unmanned, but the chain will be down for parking entrance in fact, there is usually a line of cars trying to get in so try to make it BEFORE 9am!

******If the wharf is closed due to flooding****


The official back up location is near the science center on the North Side. If so, at the wharf entrance on Ft Duquesne Blvd, there will be someone redirecting folks to the alternate location.

We park and meet on the Mon wharf, across the river from Station Square. Folks typical wear sweats , jacket, heck even a bath robe over their swim duds, and old shoes.

I'll be there by 9AM and we start to gather along the shore line. At 9:25 or so, we start getting our "beach wear" exposed and at 9:30 a whistle blows and folks start piling in! There's typically a rope and volunteers on the rivers edge to help folks in and out of the water and crazy as this sounds, it's all done with some safety in mind.

Cheers Santa Frank ;-) PS. We usually go to Deluca's Diner in the Strip Afterwards! See you at DeLuca's in the Strip 2015 Penn Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15222 afterwards!

PPS. If you want to buy a Polar Bear Club Shirt Early so you don't have to wait in line to buy it. http://www.projectbundleup.com/PolarBearJump/index.html ;

FYI: they usually have the t-shirt link avail sometime after Dec 10th)
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Frank (Big Kahuna) with FLORESCENT ORANGE BIKE FLAG!!! at 9AM!
results.name: Polar Bear Plunge! New Years Day! Mon Wharf! 9am!

River plunge takes place at 9:30 AM onNew Year's Day - January 1stDirections to Mon Wharf: Go to Wood street and turn towards River at Entrance of Fort Pitt Blvd and Wood Street you will see Entrance to MON Wharf

Looking for a few crazy Men/Women to make sure the New Year Starts off right! I've done this 7 of the last 8 years and look how I turned out! ;-)

Heads ups, you don't have to jump in yourself we need people to hold towels and laugh at us and TAKE PICS! (although the craziness is infective, if you are a towel holder about 80% jump in the next year!)

I'm doing the New Year's Polar Bear Plunge and might as well see who else is crazy enough to jump in the Monongahela on New Years Day with me.

Reminder Polar Bear Plunge is Sunday, New Years Day Jan 1st at Mon Warf at 9am official jump in is at 9:30. Buy a project bundle up T-shirt for $10. Usually about[masked] people this year might be more cause of the warm temps.

I'll be there in my Santa Hat and Red n Black Striped Robe. Afterwards a bunch of us are going to Penny's Diner in Southside afterward. If you find me good, if not find me at Penny's Diner in Southside for Breakfast. The Polar Bear Plunge is well worth doing, and this way your year starts off where you've done something completely weird and different.


ADVICE:1. GET THERE BEFORE 9AM it gets crowded fast!!!2. Have Blankets and a change of shorts, t shirts and socks3. There are safety personnel there.4. You'll have to set your stuff down leave valuables in your car.5. Drag someone else down there even if they aren't jumping then they can be towel/blanket holders and someone needs to laugh at us.6. Channel 4 news is a sponsor of this so you have a chance of being on the news.

*****************************Additional Advice from previous years...We jump from the Mon Wharf Parking directly across from Station Square.....and they leave the wharf parking entrance open...it'll look closed and unmanned, but the chain will be down for parking entrance in fact, there is usually a line of cars trying to get in so try to make it BEFORE 9am!

******If the wharf is closed due to flooding****


The official back up location is near the science center on the North Side. If so, at the wharf entrance on Ft Duquesne Blvd, there will be someone redirecting folks to the alternate location.

We park and meet on the Mon wharf, across the river from Station Square. Folks typical wear sweats , jacket, heck even a bath robe over their swim duds, and old shoes.

I'll be there by 9AM and we start to gather along the shore line. At 9:25 or so, we start getting our "beach wear" exposed and at 9:30 a whistle blows and folks start piling in! There's typically a rope and volunteers on the rivers edge to help folks in and out of the water and crazy as this sounds, it's all done with some safety in mind.

Cheers Santa Frank ;-) PS. We usually go to Deluca's Diner in the Strip Afterwards! See you at DeLuca's in the Strip 2015 Penn Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15222 afterwards!

PPS. If you want to buy a Polar Bear Club Shirt Early so you don't have to wait in line to buy it. http://www.projectbundleup.com/PolarBearJump/index.html(fyi, they usually have the t-shirt link avail sometime after Dec 10th)
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Frank (Big Kahuna) with FLORESCENT ORANGE BIKE FLAG!!! at 9AM!
results.name: Polar Bear Plunge! New Years Day! Mon Wharf! 9am!

results.description:
This is the album to use if you want your shots to be critiqued. Please don't upload to this album unless you are prepared for feedback. 

All photos posted to this album are open to constructive criticism. You do not have to add a caption or comment to say that your photo is open to criticism.

OTR: "Open for Retouching" -  If you add OTR to a caption or comment, you are agreeing that it's okay for someone to download your photograph and retouch it. Retouching will only take place if you label it as OTR.  Otherwise no one is to assume you want your photo retouched.  

NEVER download and retouch a photo without OTR (or Open to Retouching) being in the comments. It you retouch a photo without permission and put it back on the site, that retouched photo will be immediately removed.


* For the Critiquers...please be polite when you post critiques. As with all opinions they can be taken harshly when not intended that way. Make sure you re-read your comments before you post them and make sure they are as clear as possible. 

Remember to write constructive criticisms.  Tell the photographer how an image could have been improved when taking the photo and/or how to enhance it to improve it.  Your critique should not be a long list of negative qualities, but rather, a few suggestions for improvement.


Although  the official event time is 7:00 pm, the album will not open until 10 pm.
results.name: Monthly Critiques - January, 2016

results.description:
Start the year off right with one of this year's Oscar shortlist for Best Foreign Language Feature.

Theeb is a thrilling epic adventure set in 1916 in the land of Lawrence of Arabia. This Jordanian award-winner reveals the Arab revolt against the Ottoman Turks through the eyes of its young title character, a Bedouin boy who learns lessons in family, loyalty and resourcefulness when he and his brother are enlisted to find water for a British officer on long, dangerous journey. 

The riveting saga is part coming-of-age tale and part wondrous “Bedouin Western,” with a revealing elemental heart. Jordan's Oscar entry and opening night film of the 2015 Silk Screen Film Festival. (In Arabic with subtitles)


Naji Abu Nowar | United Arab Emirates, Qatar,Jordan, UK | 2014 | 100 min

Film screens at 7:30, meet in lobby beforehand.

More info and trailer:

http://cinema.pfpca.org/films/theeb
results.name: THEEB

results.description:
Join us at Swisshelm most Friday nights for contra dances. This is a recurring meetup, and we will try to cancel if there is a week without a dance, but double check the schedule at www.pittsburghcontra.org which is always up-to-date.

Dances are Fridays at Swisshelm Community Center, 8pm-11pm with a beginner's lesson at 7:30.

$7 for students, $10 for the rest of us folks.

Contra dancing is hungry business, if you'd like to bring a snack to share at the break, please do!

No experience necessary, no partner necessary, just bring your feet and a smile.

Please note that most of our community is not using Meetup.com. Though it may look like nobody is attending, rest assured that there will be lots of people at the dance!
results.name: Friday Night Contra Dance

I will provide vocabulary and lesson handouts in class as well as supplement the audio exercises with specific homework.

Materials will be distributed online for participating members.

Fee is $10 for the 1 or 2 hours.

You are welcome to stay for both sections.

Just a reminder: if you cannot come for whatever reason please be so kind as to cancel your RSVP online. That helps let me not print so many docs. And gives your spot them someone else. Merci!


This will be supplemented with other grammar / vocabulary.
